job_title: Manager of Bereavement and Volunteer Engagement in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Pikes Peak Hospice has been a great place to work for. Through the various positions I've held in the organization, I can truly say the company focuses on people. Not just the patient's and the families that are the main priority, but as an organization PPH looks out for the people who work for them too. They take time to check in with you about life, they want to discuss your dreams for the future, they talk about ways that we can improve, and they do their best to make sure people don't burn out. I heard one of our chaplains say, "Pikes Peak Hospice hires the best." And in my experience we truly do! It is great to works with a team and for a leadership who is not only competent and dutiful but also cares about me.
cons: The healthcare institution is hard. There are a lot of things that make what we do pretty clinical, which can be very difficult at end of life. Being a non-profit might mean that you have to shoulder a burden for a while before being able to release it again. It can be pretty stressful at times.

job_title: Social Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
